dataset.title: Sediment Accumulation in Salt Marshes Across the Southeastern United States
dataset.abstract: The southeast coast of the United States is home to an invaluable landscape of salt marshes. Marshes are positioned as transition zones between salty and brackish coastal waters and the terrestrial environments of the coastal plain. They are of broad ecological significance, serving as primary production zones, marine life nurseries and natural filters, absorbing and regulating nutrient exchange between terrestrial and marine environments. They are also of great economic importance, functioning as flood controls and erosion prevention/reduction systems for the coast. Marshes grow, shrink and migrate in response to sediment accretion and erosion. The factors influencing sedimentation include influx of sediment from rivers and streams, sediment supply from storm events, in situ sediment production, oceanic influx, and sea-level rise. Rates of sedimentation are expected to vary across a single marsh, between individual marshes, and from one system of marshes to another. This study examines three southeastern U.S. salt marsh systems â€“ Outer Banks of North Carolina, Georgetown area of South Carolina and Savannah area of Georgia, to evaluate how sedimentation in these three systems responds to fluvial and tidal influences. The estuarine systems where these marshes are located vary significantly in river input and tidal range, allowing for examination of relationships with these and other factors, e.g., development and erosion. Sediment accumulation rates were measured using 210Pb and 137Cs geochronology. There was great variability from marsh to marsh, and system to system. In individual marshes, shoreline cores generally had the highest accumulation rates, but this varied significantly depending on marsh morphology and the proximity of tidal creeks. Winyah Bay yielded the highest average accumulation rates, while accumulation rates in Ossabaw Sound were often more similar to those at Pea Island, NC, than to those in Winyah Bay.
dataset.intellectualRights: This dataset is listed under a Creative Commons BY 4.0 and can be used with attribution. https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Methods identification code unique to each study.
Code indicating what type of device was used to collect soil depth profiles.

codeDefinition.definition: A half cylinder coring device with the coring section sealed off by a fin attached to a rotating pivot point

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether live roots were included or excluded from carbon assessments.

codeDefinition.definition: Roots and rhizomes were included in dry bulk density and or organic matter and carbon measurements

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating whether or not sediment was sieved prior to carbon measurements.

codeDefinition.definition: Sediment was not sieved prior to analysis for organics.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating how the authors qualified or quantified compaction of the core.

codeDefinition.definition: Compaction was not specified.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were dried to measure dry bulk density. This can include either samples that were freeze dried or oven dried.
Any notable codes regarding how the authors quantified dry bulk density.

codeDefinition.definition: No additional details regarding bulk density methodology were provided
Bulk density methodology did not specify drying temperature or length, only that samples were dried to a constant mass

attribute.attributeDefinition: Temperature at which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Time over which samples were combusted to estimate fraction organic matter.
Sample mass used for loss on ignition, if held constant.
Code indicating the method used for determining radiocesium activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Alpha counting method used
Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the method used for determining lead 210 activity.

codeDefinition.definition: Alpha counting method used
Gamma counting method used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the mass or accretion rate used in the excess_pb_210_model.

codeDefinition.definition: Model run as excess 210Pb against depth.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the model used to estimate accumulation rates and/or age-depth chronologies.

codeDefinition.definition: Constant flux constant sedimentation model used.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the assumption used to estimate the core's supported 226Ra specific activities.

codeDefinition.definition: 226Ra measured by spectrometry at selected samples along the soil profile.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code indicating the reference or 0 year of the age depth model.

codeDefinition.definition: Year zero is defined as years before present, 1960 CE

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Site identification code unique to each study.

Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating average annual salinity (Note: Palustrine and freshwater should only include tidal wetlands, or wetlands that are potentially/formerly tidal but artificially freshened due to artificial tidal restrictions).
Indicate whether salinity_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Salinity inferred by field observation such as vegetation
Salinity observed from local instrument.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Any relevant submitter generated notes on how salinity_class was determined.
Code based on submitter field observations or measurement indicating dominant wetland vegetation type.

codeDefinition.definition: Describes wetlands dominated by persistent emergent vascular plants
Dominated by forested to scrub/shrub biomass
Describes tidal or subtidal communities dominated by rooted vascular plants.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether vegetation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Vegetation inferred by field observation
Vegetation measured by counts or plots.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Code based on submitter field observation or measurement indicating how often the coring location is inundated.

codeDefinition.definition: Study-specific definition of an elevation in the relative middle of the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type
Study-specific definition of an elevation in relatively low in the tidal frame, typically defined by vegetation type

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicate whether inundation_class was determined using a field observation or a measurement.

codeDefinition.definition: Inundation inferred by field observation such as vegetation
Inundation class assessed from elevation and nearby tide gauge or other similar method.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Core identification code unique to each site.
Year of core collection.
Numeric month of year of core collection.
Numeric day of month of core collection.
Positional latitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Positional longitude of the core in decimal degree WGS84.
Code indicating how latitude and longitude were determined.

codeDefinition.definition: Real-time kinematic global position system (GPS)
Any other technique resulting in positional error > 30 meters.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Surface elevation of the core relative to defined datum.
Accuracy of elevation measurement, if determined and recorded
Code indicating how elevation was determined

codeDefinition.definition: Real-time kinematic GPS
Any other technique resulting in positional error > 5 cm of random error.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Habitat classification of the sampled location based on description or dominate vegetation.

codeDefinition.definition: Wetland dominated by emergent vegetation, gramminoids or forbs.
Intertidal to subtidal and dominated by specialized predominantly submerged grasses.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Indicated whether or not the coring team believes they recovered a full sediment profile, down to bedrock, or other non-marsh interface.

codeDefinition.code: core depth limited by length of corer
codeDefinition.definition: The total depth of the core was limited by the length of the coring device

attribute.attributeDefinition: Unique identifier for the study made up of the first author's family name, as well as the second author's family name or et al. if more than three, then publication year separated by underscores.
Methods identification code unique to each study.
Site identification code unique to each study.
Core identification code unique to each site.
Minimum depth of a sampling increment.
Maximum depth of a sampling increment.
Mass of organic matter relative to sample dry mass. Ash free bulk density should not be used here but should be expressed as a loss on ignition fraction.
Radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for radiocesium (137Cs).
1 standard error of uncertainty associated with cs137_activity.
Reported unit for sample interval's Cs 137 activity measurements.
Excess radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
1 standard error of uncertainty associated with excess_pb210_activity.
Total radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for excess lead 210 (210Pb).
1 standard error of uncertainty associated with total_pb210_activity.
Total radioactivity counts per unit dry weight for Radium 226 (226Ra) if measured as part of the_210Pb dating process.
1 standard error of uncertainty associated with ra226_activity.
Reported unit for sample interval's Ra 226 activity measurements.

unit.name: nominalMonth
unit.description: one month excluding leap seconds and leap days, 2628000 seconds
